page.title: 18LYDFORD VILLAGE HALL
page.content: In 1929 the Hall at Lydford was erected and given to the village by Frederick James Ware Nicholls of Torside, Lydford, always to be called, managed and carried on under the name of the Nicholls Hall.It is run by a committee of management who provide and maintain the Hall for the use of the inhabitants of Lydford. The Nicholls Hall is used all the year round by the youth club and badminton club on a regular weekly basis and by the Lydford W.I. on a monthly basis. Various organisations hold meetings and organise fund raising events. Wedding receptions, parties and dances are held.Money raised or payments received from bookings is used for repairs, insurance,electricity,gas and improvements to the Hall.
